intro: Schizolaena cavacoana, commonly known as the Cape York daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty environments. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Schizolaena cavacoana is a hardy species that thrives in well-drained conditions and is often found in coastal heathlands.
